Text.Value: Not now, sorry. I have to comfort these little warriors.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The children were scared and they are still actively too scared to be training

Text.Value: Fierce little fighters, aren't they?
Good job. Now they're even more scared.
A warrior like you could lift their spirits.
I'll lift their spirits by wiping out that whole camp of goblins by myself.
You must outsmart and outmanoeuvre. Your greatest weapon is your cunning!
I slit my own cousin's throat and tasted her blood.
The Blade of Frontiers. What a thrill for the children.
Can't talk now. The children need me.
Bad news, children: you're all going to die.
Leave.
Leave.
The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.
I think you've inspired them enough today.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautious, not giving offense, but the player fucked it up the first time.

Text.Value: These hatchlings are weak. Your teachings will fail.
I saw you at the gates. You fight well.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this node

Text.Value: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.
A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be included
EditorData.NodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic node: the children gasp in horror and S_DEN_Trainee_001 starts crying.|
EditorData.SFXTags: SFX crowd of 3 kid gasping and one start crying

Text.Value: Soak the battlefield with blood. Do not resist death, but embrace it!
Good job. Little ears hear far - I better take care of this.
A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be included
EditorData.NodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Text.Value: I once sliced out a scavver's eye and ate it whole - and not out of hunger.
They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?
Thanks. I prefer when they smile.
After great adversity comes triumph. Honour and glory!
They're tough kids. Smart, too. The future's in good hands.
Be strong and watch over your kin. In trust there is victory!
I will rip off a horrid mind flayer's head and gift it to my Lich Queen!
Look at them beaming. You did that.
I don't think...
Not now, sorry. I have to comfort these little warriors.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The children were scared but they have now resumed their training

Text.Value: You're just going to get them killed - probably by each other.
I crawled inside a red dragon's corpse to stay warm among the Tears of Selûne.
Thanks for spending time with the kids. I just wish... well. Thanks.
Can't talk now. The children need me.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Delete this node if it can be the same as the one below

Synopsis: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
